items.sentence: It would\'ve been nice if you\'d helped me a little.
I think Tom might actually want someone to kill him.
Tom and Mary admired the scenery as they held hands.
I want to be able to play the violin as well as Tom.
If it is worth doing at all, it is worth doing well.
Is there anything you want us to send you from home?
Tom said it was all perfectly normal, but it isn\'t.
Tom said that he didn\'t know what Mary looked like.
Tom said that he didn\'t want to eat dinner tonight.
My problem is I love Mary, but she doesn\'t love me.
I have just been to the station to see my uncle off.
You don\'t plan to stay in Boston very long, do you?
I\'ve already told Tom I don\'t know how to do that.
I\'ve already told Tom I don\'t want him to do that.
Don\'t you think it\'s strange that Tom isn\'t here?
Tom doesn\'t need to do that if he doesn\'t want to.
Tom\'s idiosyncrasies take a bit of getting used to.
Tom\'s talents could be put to better use elsewhere.
Tom thought that Mary wouldn\'t like Malaysian food.
Let\'s not do anything that might get us in trouble.
Let\'s not forget that Tom is depending on our help.
Let\'s see if we can come up with a better solution.
Tom won the lottery, but went bankrupt a year later.
Tom is going to go sailing with Mary this afternoon.
Tom is talking with someone right now. Can you wait?
Tom doesn\'t know what Mary is trying to accomplish.
Tom tried to get the splinter out of Mary\'s finger.
Tom usually starts his day with a hot cup of coffee.
Tom wanted to spend the rest of his life in America.
Tom wants me to go to Boston with him to visit Mary.
Tom pulled the nail out of the board with a crowbar.
Tom put his arms around Mary and hugged her tightly.
Which hotel will you stay in when you\'re in Boston?
Tom is the best dancer in the group and he knows it.
Tom is the one who convinced Mary to try to do that.
Tom is the one who should be blamed for the failure.
Tom and Mary were shocked, and John was embarrassed.
Tom ate breakfast while his wife read the newspaper.
Tom called Mary to ask her to help at the bake sale.
Tom and Mary know something they\'re not telling us.
I\'ve already done everything Tom has told me to do.
Tom earns more money in an hour than I do in a week.
Tom had no choice except to accept the consequences.
Tom had to listen to the whole story all over again.
Tom has a few more things to do before he can leave.
Tom told me he was interested in visiting Australia.
Tom realized he wouldn\'t likely be able to do that.
Tom realized there was no way he\'d be able do that.
Tom said he didn\'t know anything about the robbery.
Tom said he didn\'t know what Mary wanted him to do.
